entry.et: Middle French qualifier, from Medieval Latin qualificare, from Latin qualis

def.dt: :to reduce from a general to a particular or restricted form :modify
:to alter the strength or flavor of
:to limit or modify the meaning of (as a noun)
:to characterize by naming an attribute :describe cannot qualify it as … either glad or sorry T. S. Eliot
:to fit by training, skill, or ability for a special purpose
:to be or become fit (as for an office) :meet the required standard
:to acquire legal or competent power or capacity has just qualified as a lawyer
:to exhibit a required degree of ability in a preliminary contest qualified for the finals
:to shoot well enough to earn a marksmanship badge
